data.enText: despite the fact that
data.chText: 虽然；尽管；即使

data.enText: Anne was fond of Tim, though he often annoyed her.
data.chText: 安妮喜欢蒂姆，虽然他经常使她心烦。

data.enText: Though she gave no sign, I was sure she had seen me.
data.chText: 尽管她没有示意，我还是确信她看见了我。

data.enText: His clothes, though old and worn, looked clean and of good quality.
data.chText: 他的衣服虽然很旧，但看上去干干净净，质地很好。

data.enText: Strange though it may sound, I was pleased it was over.
data.chText: 尽管听起来也许很奇怪，但我很高兴这都结束了。

data.enText: used to add a fact or an opinion that makes the previous statement less strong or less important
data.chText: （用于主句后，引出补充说明，使语气变弱）不过，可是，然而

data.enText: They're very different, though they did seem to get on well when they met.
data.chText: 他们大不相同，可是见面后好像还确实相处得不错。

data.enText: He'll probably say no, though it's worth asking.
data.chText: 他很可能会拒绝，不过问一下有益无损。

data.enText: even if/though
despite the fact or belief that; no matter whether
data.chText: 即使；纵然；虽然

data.enText: I'll get there, even if I have to walk.
data.chText: 我就是走也要走到那儿去。

data.enText: I like her, even though she can be annoying at times.
data.chText: 尽管她有时可能很烦人，我还是喜欢她。

data.enText: used especially at the end of a sentence to add a fact or an opinion that makes the previous statement less strong or less important
data.chText: （尤用于句末补充说明，使语气减弱）不过，可是，然而

data.enText: Our team lost. It was a good game though.
data.chText: 我们队输了，可是这也不失为一场好球。

data.enText: ‘Have you ever been to Australia?’ ‘No. I'd like to, though.’
data.chText: “你去过澳大利亚吗？”“没有，不过我很想去。”

data.enText: You can use these words to show contrast between two clauses or two sentences. Though is used more in spoken than in written English. You can use although , even though and though at the beginning of a sentence or clause that has a verb. Notice where the commas go.
data.chText: 在两个从句或句子之间可用上述的词表示对比。though多用于口语。although、even though和though可用于句首或带有动词的从句开头。注意逗号的位置：

data.enText: Although/Even though/Though everyone played well, we lost the game.
We lost the game, although/even though/though everyone played well.
data.chText: 尽管每个人都打得不错，我们还是输了。

data.enText: You cannot use even on its own at the beginning of a sentence or clause instead of although , even though or though .
data.chText: even不能单独置于句首或从句开头以代替although、even though或though：

data.enText: Even everyone played well, we lost the game.

means: (用于主句后，引出补充说明，使语气变弱)不过，可是，然而
(尤用于句末补充说明，使语气减弱)不过，可是，然而

ex.enText: Although it was dark, he still worked in the field.
ex.chText: 天黑了，他依然在田里劳作。

ex.enText: We bought the car although it was old.
ex.chText: 虽然这辆车是旧的,我们还是买了下来。

synonyms.bx: 通常置于句首并用于正式场合，不能像 though 那样用于省略句或引出倒装语序的让步状语从句。

ex.enText: Hard as he works, he can't support his family.
ex.chText: 他工作努力，可还是无法养活一家人。

ex.enText: Pretty as she is, no one likes her.
ex.chText: 她很美丽，但没人喜欢她。

synonyms.bx: 作此义解时，只用于倒装语序结构中，语气强于 although 和 though。

ex.enText: Though (he is) living alone, he is very happy.
ex.chText: 他虽然一个人生活，但很愉快。

ex.enText: Though (he is) certainly not a lady-killer, he is still very attractive.
ex.chText: 他虽然还不至于让女人一见倾心，却很有魅力。

ex.enText: Strange though it may sound, I was pleased it was over.
ex.chText: 尽管听起来也许很奇怪，但我很高兴这都结束了。

synonyms.bx: 在文体上不如 although 正式，常用于省略句，或引出倒装语序的让步状语从句。

data.enText: as if/as though
in a way that suggests sth
data.chText: 似乎；好像；仿佛

data.enText: He behaved as if nothing had happened.
data.chText: 他表现得若无其事。

data.enText: It sounds as though you had a good time.
data.chText: 听起来你好像过得挺愉快。

data.enText: It's my birthday. As if you didn't know!
data.chText: 今天是我的生日。你好像不知道似的！

data.enText: ‘Don't say anything.’ ‘ As if I would! ’ (= surely you do not expect me to)
data.chText: “什么也别说。”“我才不会说呢！”

data.enText: even if/though
despite the fact or belief that; no matter whether
data.chText: 即使；纵然；虽然

data.enText: I'll get there, even if I have to walk.
data.chText: 我就是走也要走到那儿去。

data.enText: I like her, even though she can be annoying at times.
data.chText: 尽管她有时可能很烦人，我还是喜欢她。

value.boxr_value: Pronounced /ðəʊ/ for meanings 1 and 2, and /'ðəʊ/ for meanings 3 to 5. 义项 1、2 读作 /ðəʊ/，义项 3 至 5 在句中作重读。

example.ex: Gaelic has been a dying language for many years, though children are nowadays taught it in school...
example.tran: 盖尔语多年来一直濒于消亡，尽管如今孩子们还在学校学习这门语言。

example.ex: After news of this new court case Ford broke down again, though he blamed the breakdown on his work...
example.tran: 福特听到这一场新官司的消息后再次精神崩溃，尽管他说自己是因为工作才这样的。

example.ex: He's very attractive, though certainly not a ladykiller...
example.tran: 他很有魅力，虽然还不至于使女人一见倾心。

example.ex: Cleveland has always had a reputation for being a dirty, ugly, boring city, though now they say it is much better.
example.tran: 克利夫兰一直因其环境脏乱、市容丑陋、沉闷无趣而恶名在外，尽管据说现在好多了。

value.def: You use though to introduce a statement in a subordinate clause which contrasts with the statement in the main clause. You often use though to introduce a fact which you regard as less important than the fact in the main clause.

example.ex: I look back on it as the bloodiest (though not literally) winter of the war...
example.tran: 我现在回想起来，觉得那是战时最血腥的(但并非字面意义上的)一个冬天。

example.ex: The problem was finally, though not conclusively, identified as a severely pinched nerve...
example.tran: 问题终于被认定为是神经受到严重挤压，尽管这还不是最终结论。

example.ex: His achievements, though hardly exciting, were widely admired.
example.tran: 尽管他的成就不怎么激动人心，可依然备受赞赏。

value.def: You use though to introduce a subordinate clause which gives some information that is relevant to the main clause and weakens the force of what it is saying.

example.ex: I like him. Though he makes me angry sometimes...
example.tran: 我喜欢他，不过他有时惹我生气。

example.ex: I want to try my hand at politics, or go back to the law. I don't want to go to school for it, though...
example.tran: 我想进入政坛，或者重操律师旧业。不过我不想进学校去专门学习。

example.ex: It might be worth your while to go to court. This is tricky, though, and you'll need expert advice.
example.tran: 对你来说这官司或许值得一打，不过这件事有点棘手，你需要专家的建议。

value.def: You use though to indicate that the information in a clause contrasts with or modifies information given in a previous sentence or sentences.

example.ex: I'm a good cook, though I say it myself...
example.tran: 我并非自夸，我的厨艺的确高超。

example.ex: Even though I do say it myself we've probably got the best little restaurant in town.
example.tran: 不是我吹牛，我们的小饭店可能是全城最好的。

value.def: You can say though I say so myself or even though I say it myself when you are praising yourself or something you have done, but do not want to sound too proud.
